qas.question: To the church of Scotland, what is the sub standard doctrine?
Who was one person who did not fully believe the struggle of conscience?
The Free Church in Scotland  has something in place that only a few churches have implemented, what is it called?
What is the subordinate standard doctrine to the Word of God?
Who believed fully in the Word of God?
Which is an example of a church that has such a conscience clause?
Which is the principal standard of the Church of Faith?

context: <a0_0><b3_0><b6_0>The Westminster Confession<b6_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> is "The principal subordinate standard of the Church of Scotland" but "with due regard to liberty of opinion in points which do not enter into the substance of the Faith" (V). This formulation represents many years of struggle over the extent to which the confession reflects the Word of God and the struggle of conscience of those who came to believe it did not fully do so (e.g. <a1_0><b4_0>William Robertson Smith<b4_0/><a1_0/>). Some Presbyterian Churches, such as the <b5_0>Free Church of Scotland<b5_0/>, have no such "<a2_0>conscience clause<a2_0/>".
